# Alliant Energy Corporation (LNT) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Alliant Energy Corporation operates as a utility holding company that provides regulated electric and natural gas services in the United States. It operates through IPL and WPL segments. The company provides regulated energy service to approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers across Iowa and Wisconsin.

The company, through its subsidiary, Interstate Power and Light Company (IPL), engages primarily in the generation and distribution of electricity and the distribution and transportation of natural gas to retail customers in select markets in Iowa. Through Wisconsin Power and Light Company (WPL), it generates and distributes electricity, and distributes and transports natural gas to retail customers in select markets in Wisconsin.

It serves retail customers in the farming, agriculture, industrial manufacturing, chemical, packaging, and food industries, as well as wholesale customers comprising municipalities and rural electric cooperatives. The company was formerly known as Interstate Energy Corp. and changed its name to Alliant Energy Corporation in May 1999. Alliant Energy Corporation is headquartered in Madison, Wisconsin.

## 2. Current Market Data

The current price of LNT is 67.08 USD — it has decreased by −0.09% in the past 24 hours. Today Alliant Energy Corporation has the market capitalization of ‪17.29 B‬, it has decreased by −0.32% over the last week.

According to analysts, LNT price has a max estimate of 78.00 USD and a min estimate of 67.00 USD. The average 12-month price target for Alliant Energy is USD72, with a high estimate of USD79 and a low estimate of USD65. 6 analysts recommend buying the stock, while 1 suggest selling, leading to an overall rating of Buy.

LNT stock has risen by 2.23% compared to the previous week, the month change is a 2.84% rise, over the last year Alliant Energy has showed a 9.54% increase. The stock has fluctuated within a 52-week range spans from 56.30 to 69.75.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

• **Electric Utility Services**: Generation and distribution of electricity across Iowa and Wisconsin
• **Natural Gas Services**: Distribution and transportation of natural gas to retail customers
• **Steam Generation**: Generates and distributes steam for two customers in Cedar Rapids, Iowa
• **Non-Utility Operations**: 
  - Short-line rail freight service in Iowa; a Mississippi River barge, rail, and truck freight terminal in Illinois; freight brokerage services; wind turbine blade recycling services; and a rail-served warehouse in Iowa
  - Interests in a natural gas-fired electric generating unit near Sheboygan Falls, Wisconsin; and a wind farm located in Oklahoma

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

### Renewable Energy Projects
• **Wind Generation**: Alliant Energy announced plans to add up to 1,000 megawatts (MW) of wind energy generation in Iowa
• **Solar Projects**: The energy company is now generating 400 MW of new solar energy resources in Iowa. Across Iowa and Wisconsin, Alliant has deployed 1,500 MW of solar power since 2022
• **Energy Storage**: The Columbia Energy Storage Project is the first long-duration energy storage project of its kind to be developed in the United States

### Columbia Energy Storage Project
The system's unique features will boost grid stability and deliver enough electricity to power approximately 18,000 Wisconsin homes for 10 hours on a single charge. Construction is expected to begin in 2026 and be completed by the end of 2027.

## 5. Growth Strategy

The Company announced 2026 earnings guidance at $3.36 to $3.46 per share, continuing its strong 10-year track record of compound annual earnings growth of 6%. The company plans to target a 7-8% earnings growth from 2027 to 2029, driven by strategic investments and data center load growth.

Key strategic pillars:
• **Data Center Focus**: With the signed agreement Alliant Energy expects its peak energy demand to grow an industry leading 50% by 2030
• **Capital Investment**: The energy resources to serve this expected load, while maintaining safe and reliable service to all customers, have increased the Company's forecasted capital expenditures for 2026-2029 to $13.4 billion
• **Renewable Transition**: We aspire to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions from our utility operations by 2050

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

### Data Center Clients
• **Google**: The Google project is projected at $576 million in Cedar Rapids
• **QTS Data Centers**: Alliant Energy's utilities Interstate Power and Light Company (IPL) and Wisconsin Power and Light Company (WPL) now have 3 gigawatts of contracted demand from data centers with the inclusion of the recently executed electric service agreement (ESA) for 900 megawatts for the QTS Madison site
• QTS is advancing plans for a $12 billion data center campus in Dane County

### Traditional Customer Base
Alliant Energy Corporation provides regulated energy service to approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers across Iowa and Wisconsin. Customers span farming, agriculture, industrial manufacturing, chemical, packaging, and food industries.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Q3 2025 Results
Alliant Energy Corporation announced earnings per share (EPS) of $1.09 for the third quarter of 2025, compared to $1.15 for the same quarter in 2024. Revenue: 1.21 billion dollars, below the forecast of 1.32 billion dollars.

The ongoing EPS for the third quarter was $1.12, compared to $1.15 in the same quarter in 2024. For the first nine months of 2025, Alliant Energy reported ongoing EPS of $2.62 for the first three quarters, representing a 12.4% increase from $2.33 during the same period in 2024.

### Guidance and Projections
Alliant Energy narrowed its full-year 2025 earnings guidance range to $3.17-3.23 per share and initiated 2026 guidance at $3.36-3.46 per share. Alliant Energy has increased its 2026 expected annual common stock dividend target to $2.14 per share.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Tailwinds
• **Data Center Boom**: Explosive growth in AI and cloud computing driving unprecedented demand
• **Regulatory Support**: Approved renewable energy projects and supportive rate structures
• **Tax Credits**: All tax credits ($1.5 billion) generated through 2028 would be transferable
• **Energy Transition**: Strong positioning in renewable energy development

### Headwinds
• **Regulatory Risk**: Dependency on state regulatory approvals for rate changes and projects
• **Interest Rate Sensitivity**: Higher financing costs impacting capital-intensive utility operations
• **Execution Risk**: Large capital expenditure programs require successful project delivery
• **Weather Dependency**: Normal weather assumptions impact earnings guidance

## 9. Market Shares

As a regulated utility, Alliant Energy holds near-monopoly positions in its service territories:
• **Iowa**: Serves portions of the state through Interstate Power and Light (IPL)
• **Wisconsin**: Serves southern and central Wisconsin through Wisconsin Power and Light (WPL)
• Approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers across Iowa and Wisconsin

The company faces limited direct competition due to regulated utility structure, with market share determined by geographic service territories rather than competitive market dynamics.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

### Key Competitors
Alliant Energy's main competitors include Xcel Energy, MidAmerican Energy, Ameren Corporation, WEC Energy Group, and Nisource Inc.

**WEC Energy Group**:
• Together, we provide energy services to 4.7 million customers in Wisconsin, Illinois, Michigan and Minnesota
• The trailing twelve month revenue for WEC Energy Group is $9.5B
• WEC Energy Group's EPS for 12 months was $5.23

**Alliant Energy Position**:
• The trailing twelve month revenue for Alliant Energy is $4.14B
• Alliant Energy's EPS for 12 months was $3.24
• Smaller scale but focused on high-growth data center markets

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### Key Partnerships
• **Energy Dome**: Partnership for Columbia Energy Storage Project using innovative CO2 battery technology
• **QTS Data Centers**: Alliant Energy and QTS Data Centers announced an agreement in principle to enable renewable energy resources across Wisconsin
• **American Transmission Company**: Alliant also owns a 16% interest in American Transmission Co.

### Joint Ventures
Development of the Columbia Energy Storage Project is led by Alliant Energy in partnership with Wisconsin Public Service Corporation, a subsidiary of WEC Energy Group, Madison Gas and Electric, and the Electric Power Research Institute.

## 12. Recent Developments

### January 2026
• Alliant Energy Corporation Announces Fourth Quarter and Year-End 2025 Earnings Release and Conference Call (January 2026)
• Alliant Energy Corp. announced its Board of Directors has appointed Manu Asthana as a new independent director, effective Feb. 23, 2026

### Q4 2025/Q1 2026
• The Alliant Energy Corporation Board of Directors today declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.5350 per share payable on February 17, 2026
• Wells Fargo initiates Alliant Energy stock with Overweight rating (January 2026)

### Q3 2025 Highlights
• Increased contracted data center demand to 3 GW, representing a 50% increase in peak load demand by 2030
• Increased 4-year capital expenditure forecast by 17% to $13.4 billion to meet growing demand

## 13. AI Investment Rating & Fair Value Assessment

### Current Dividend Information
InvestingPro data reveals Alliant has an impressive record of raising its dividend for 22 consecutive years, with a current yield of 2.92%. Our 2026 annual common stock dividend target is $2.14 per share, a 5.4% increase from 2025.

### Investment Strengths
• Strong 6% compound annual earnings growth track record over 10 years
• Industry-leading 50% peak demand growth expected by 2030 from data center expansion
• Secured 3 GW of contracted data center demand with active pipeline
• $13.4 billion capital expenditure program through 2029
• Net-zero emissions target by 2050 with strong renewable development
• Regulated utility model providing stable cash flows

### Investment Considerations
• Q3 2025 earnings miss indicates execution challenges with higher O&M costs
• Large capital investment program increases regulatory and execution risk
• Concentration in Midwest markets limits geographic diversification
• Weather dependency impacts quarterly performance

### Valuation Metrics
• Current P/E ratio: approximately 21x
• Average 12-month price target: $72 (high: $79, low: $65)
• Current stock price: ~$67
• Market capitalization: $17.29 billion

**Buy Rating: 7.5/10**

**Estimated Fair Value: $75-78**

**Rationale**: Alliant Energy presents a compelling growth story driven by data center demand that should accelerate earnings growth above the historical 6% rate. The company's strategic positioning in the AI/data center boom, combined with strong regulatory relationships and renewable energy transition, supports a premium valuation. However, execution risks around the large capital program and recent earnings volatility warrant a moderate approach. The stock offers attractive upside potential of 10-15% to fair value range with a growing dividend yield approaching 3.1%.
tldr_summary:
Alliant Energy Corporation is a utility holding company providing regulated electric and natural gas services across Iowa and Wisconsin, serving approximately 1 million electric and 430,000 natural gas customers. The company is experiencing significant growth through strategic investments in data centers, renewable energy, and grid modernization, with major clients like Google and QTS driving a projected 50% peak energy demand increase by 2030.

Key strategic initiatives include expanding wind and solar generation, developing innovative energy storage solutions like the Columbia Energy Storage Project, and targeting net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. The company plans $13.4 billion in capital expenditures through 2029, focusing on data center infrastructure and renewable energy transitions. With a strong track record of 6% compound annual earnings growth and a regulated utility model providing stable cash flows, Alliant Energy is positioning itself as a forward-looking energy infrastructure provider.

The AI buy rating is 7.5/10 with a fair value of $75-78, reflecting solid growth potential balanced against execution risks in its ambitious expansion strategy.
